intrestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nation member states and 2 observer states.
India has the world's largest democracy and a rich cultural history.
Japan is known for its cherry blossoms, sushi, and advanced robotics.
There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 UN member states and 2 observer states.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest and famous for its Carnival festival.
Australia is the only country that is also a continent and is famous for the Great Barrier Reef.
Germany is known for its engineering, Oktoberfest, and being a leader in the EU.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world's lakes combined.
South Africa has three capital cities and is known as the 'Rainbow Nation' due to its diversity.
France is the most visited country in the world and known for its fashion, cuisine, and the Eiffel Tower.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the highest peak in the world.
